sentences.text: Russian writer (1828–1910) "Tolstoy" and "Lev Tolstoy" redirect here.
For other uses, see Tolstoy (disambiguation) and Lev Tolstoy (disambiguation) .
Count Lev Nikolayevich Tolstoy [ note 1 ] ( / ˈ t oʊ l s t ɔɪ , ˈ t ɒ l -/ ; Russian: Лев Николаевич Толстой , [ note 2 ] IPA: [ˈlʲef nʲɪkɐˈla(j)ɪvʲɪtɕ tɐlˈstoj] ⓘ ; 9 September [ O.S.
7 November] 1910), usually referred to in English as Leo Tolstoy , was a Russian writer.
He is regarded as one of the greatest and most influential authors of all time.

elements.name: Category
elements.text: as one of the greatest and most influential authors of all time

sentences.text: Born to an aristocratic family, Tolstoy achieved acclaim in his twenties with his semi-autobiographical trilogy, Childhood , Boyhood and Youth (1852–1856), and with Sevastopol Sketches (1855), based on his experiences in the Crimean War .

elements.name: Reason
elements.text: with his semi-autobiographical trilogy, Childhood, Boyhood and Youth (1852–1856), and with Sevastopol Sketches (1855 ) based on his experiences in the Crimean War

sentences.text: His War and Peace (1869), Anna Karenina (1878), and Resurrection (1899), which is based on his youthful sins, are often cited as pinnacles of realist fiction and three of the greatest novels ever written.

elements.name: Specified_entity
elements.text: His War and Peace (1869 ), Anna Karenina (1878 ), and Resurrection (1899 ), which is based on his youthful sins,

elements.name: Role
elements.text: as pinnacles of realist fiction and three of the greatest novels ever written

sentences.text: His oeuvre includes short stories such as " Alyosha the Pot " (1911) and " After the Ball " (1911) and novellas such as Family Happiness (1859), The Death of Ivan Ilyich (1886), The Kreutzer Sonata (1889), The Devil (1911), and Hadji Murat (1912).

elements.name: Part
elements.text: short stories such as " Alyosha the Pot " (1911) and " After the Ball " (1911) and novellas such as Family Happiness (1859 ), The Death of Ivan Ilyich (1886 ), The Kreutzer Sonata (1889 ), The Devil (1911 ), and Hadji Murat (1912

sentences.text: He also wrote plays and essays concerning philosophical, moral and religious themes.

elements.name: Text
elements.text: plays and essays concerning philosophical, moral and religious themes

sentences.text: In the 1870s, Tolstoy experienced a profound moral crisis, followed by what he regarded as an equally profound spiritual awakening, as outlined in his non-fiction work Confession (1882).

elements.name: Category
elements.text: as an equally profound spiritual awakening

sentences.text: His literal interpretation of the ethical teachings of Jesus, centering on the Sermon on the Mount , caused him to become a fervent Christian anarchist and pacifist .

elements.name: Item
elements.text: of the ethical teachings of Jesus

elements.name: Cause
elements.text: His literal interpretation of the ethical teachings of Jesus, centering on the Sermon on the Mount

elements.name: Effect
elements.text: to become a fervent Christian anarchist and pacifist

elements.name: Final_category
elements.text: a fervent Christian anarchist and pacifist

sentences.text: His ideas on nonviolent resistance , expressed in such works as The Kingdom of God Is Within You (1894), had a profound impact on such pivotal 20th-century figures as Mahatma Gandhi , Ludwig Wittgenstein , Martin Luther King Jr. , and James Bevel .

elements.name: Medium
elements.text: in such works as The Kingdom of God Is Within You (1894
